fields.description:
*Summary*

When editing the project notification page which is meant for internal notification, you are able to add "customer accounts" within this page. 

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Go to the project notification page
# Click on "Actions" > "Edit Notification"
# Choose an event, click on "Add"
# Choose "Single User", try to type the email address of a customer, it will populate and allow you to add it. 


*Expected Results*

It should only populate licensed internal users. The customer account should not populate as it can set the wrong expectations that the customers can receive internal notification.

*Actual Results*

It populates customer account and if the customer account is added, no notification can be sent as the account has no application license which is expected.
fields.summary: Customer Account Populate in the Project's Notification page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently with [Next-Gen Service desk templates enabled | https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/get-early-access-to-the-next-gen-jira-service-desk-experience/] there is no option to reorder the request types

h3. Suggested Solution
Add option to drag and drop request type oder for feature parity of Classic Service desk Project to be able to reorder the request types by "drag and drop" to arrange them into the preferred positions.

h3. Workaround
Delete all request types and re-add them in the order you want them to appear in the portal
fields.summary: Option to Reorder Request Types in Next-Gen Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A 1-star rating JSD CSAT can be set unknowingly when customers using Outlook mail client to reply to Jira Service Desk mail notification.

This is suspected to be caused by the mail client visiting any links in an email in the background which resulted in the rating to be populated.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# As a customer, reply to a resolved JSD mail without selecting any value(CSAT rating) for the resolved issue via Outlook mail client.

h3. Workaround
No workaround available at the moment except customers to explicitly select a rating for JSD CSAT in the email.
fields.summary: 1-star rating CSAT is set unknowingly when using Outlook mail client

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When click "Create Subtask" button, user only able to key in the "Summary" of the subtask from the "inline" update.
h3. Suggested Solution

In "New Issue View" , when click "Create Subtask" button , it will pop up subtask screen for users to fill in the information.
h3. Why this is important

It makes the user experience better for user to create subtask.
h3. Workaround
 # Users can either click on the sub-task to access it directly and then edit it accordingly or;
 # Users can disable the "New Jira issue view" for now, by:
 ## Clicking the profile icon, on the bottom of the left sidebar, then *Settings* under "JIRA";
 ## On the "Jira Labs" section, clicking to disable the *New Jira issue view*.

_Note: This workaround doesn't apply to next-gen projects._
fields.summary: Create Subtask button should open an issue creation screen for users to fill in the information

fields.description:
Hi,

Can I set an attachment limitation? I just want the attachment types that I have specified to be installed(PDF, Word etc.). For example, I think the .exe file could be vulnerable. How can I ensure security?

Best Regards
fields.summary: Attachment Limitation

fields.description:
Hi,

We have about 125 projects in our Service Desk Cloud (one per customer) .

For each project, only custemers added to that organisation can email issues.

So in some other customer attempts, that is rejected in Jira SD but no automail to customer.

And no email or alarm to some Admin i Jira or so.

 

For that reason, we daily check Service Desk log, to see if there are any failures.

And write a manual email to sender.

 

In order to more easyly identify new errors in the log, we would appreciate the function of deleting individual row(s)  (that we have managed completely) in the log .

 

BR

Catrine
fields.summary: Delete row(s) in Service Desk Mail Log

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

Currently, for any actions made or for any incremental value done in a ticket, you will have to manually calculate, for example, the number of times X agent commented on the ticket or the number of times an issue transitioned to status Y. 
 
*Suggested Solution*

It would be beneficial if the automation functionality supports a counter which you can set, that calculates each time a particular action is triggered within a ticket. The counter is also able to incrementally increase the number and update the field as the number of times the action performed increases.
fields.summary: Have to Ability to Increment Counter via Automation

fields.description:
Hi

I have been trialling JIRA Service Desk and it currently isn't possible to extract a report of customer tickets that will show external comments only. When you export a CSV file with the current fields this will export all comments with no distinction between an external and internal comment. 

 

Could Jira Service Desk have a reporting feature that will allow us to export just external comments and/or internal?

 

The reason I'm requesting this is that we currently send a customer pack which will include all customer-facing comments that have been added to our customer's tickets. As we can't export a report that only includes only external comments this is preventing us from from moving from CRM to Jira Service Desk.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk (Cloud) - Export external comments only

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a linked issue from a JSD request, images in the description field fail to load in the newly created issue. Switching to the old issue view will show the image in the description field correctly.

Original JSD ticket:
 !Original_jsd_ticket_with_image.png|thumbnail!

Linked issued created (in the new issue view):
 !newly_created_linked_issue_new_issue_view.png|thumbnail!

Linked issued created (in the old issue view):
 !newly_created_linked_issue_old_issue_view.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Use option 'Create linked issue ́ to copy ticket into a different project
 2. Select checkbox 'Copy attachments' to make sure that images are included in the new ticket
 3. Click on 'Create'
 4. Open the newly created linked issue in the new issue view
h3. Expected Results

Image is correctly loaded and displayed in the newly created issue description
h3. Actual Results

The image in the new issue is not shown. There is a message saying 'Failed to load'
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Images fail to load in the new issue view when creating linked issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the run-rule is set as "The user who triggered the rule". Automation set for transition the issue to close in xx number of minutes/hours/days fails with error: this user was deleted.
 !This user was deleted.png|thumbnail! 
  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the automation as such: 
 !Automation rule.png|thumbnail! 
 # Create an issue
 # Set issue as the status set in "When this happens"
 # Wait for the time set in automation

h3. Expected Results

Automation runs as expected and the issue will be transitioned to the status set in the result
h3. Actual Results

Gets error "This user was deleted":  
 !This user was deleted.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Change the run rule as Project default (The user should have permissions to the service desk project and perform the transition issue permissions)
 !Project default.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When run rule is set as "The user who triggered the rule". Automation set for issue close in xx number of minutes/hours/days fails with error : this user was deleted

fields.description: Currently, fields with long values do not word wrap in new issue view making the user click on the field and scroll through the text in order to read everything there.
fields.summary: Allow word wrap on long valued fields in new issue view

fields.description: Currently, there is no provision to change the email template for a password reset for the customer account. As a user, there should be functionality to set the layout of the password reset email for customer.
fields.summary: As a user there should be functionality to set the layout of the password reset email for customer

fields.description: It would be nice if it there was an option when creating or modifying an *Automation* rule which would allow the rule to bypass the *Notifications* scheme and/or the *Customer notifications* scheme entirely for each action of that *Automation* rule.
fields.summary: Allow configurability of notifications triggered from Automation rules

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When performing a JQL search using the SLA function *remaining()*, breached issues are returned.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the issue navigator (Search > Advanced search for issues > Switch to JQL);
 # Perform a search using the function remaining, like in the example below {code:sql}"Time to resolution" < remaining("2h"){code}
 # Observe the results.

h3. Expected Results

This function shouldn't return breached issues according to [Commonly used functions when writing SLA queries|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/write-jql-queries-for-slas/#Commonly-used-functions-when-writing-SLA-queries]
{quote}*remaining()*

This filters issues whose SLA cycle's clock meets a specified time condition before the issue will breach an SLA goal.
{quote}
h3. Actual Results

Breached issues are included in the search results.
h3. Workaround

Add "*{{AND "SLA Name" != breached()}}*" to your query
 Example:
{code:sql}
"Time to resolution" < remaining("2h") AND "Time to resolution" != breached()
{code}
fields.summary: JQL for SLA function remaining() returns breached issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Approve/decline requests shown in a Filter Result gadget doesn't Approve/Decline the request.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a workflow, which includes a Status for  Approval
# Create a dashboard with *Filter request* gadget.
# Create an issue
* Observe that the issue is listed in the Dashboard ( Filter request gadget )
* Click on the three dots on the right-hand side of the issue
* If you are approver, you will be presented with a lot of options, including approve, Decline
* Click on approve, observe that no action is being taken
* Click on Decline and no action is taken again.
* Clicking on other options transitions, assign to me, add a comment, etc works well.

Manually accessing the issue and approving/ declining the issue works.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The request should be approved or Declined accordingly.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens. No action is taken.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Approve/decline requests shown in a Filter Result gadget doesn't Approve/Decline the request

fields.description:
I would like to see the option to hide some of the automated notifcations in the customer portal. Only when the customers receives an e-mail about a status update I would like tot see that notification in the customer portal. But no all transaction status changes have value for the customer. Some are usefull for backoffice.

When now a customer reviews an issue it is cluttered with automated notifications. 

And all other solutions to manage the bulk of notifications in the customer portal are welcome.
fields.summary: Manage portal automated notifications.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
custom date and time field do not display the sample time in the reporter's timezone on the customer portal. It displays the example of the time based on the browser's timezone and that confuses the customer

However, once the time is added in the time field, the value is taken into consideration based on the customer's timezone only.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the Jira time zone to something other than your local browser timezone (Example: GMT+7)
# Set your Atlassian account timezone to something other than your local browser timezone or the Jira's timezone (Example GMT-9)

h3. Expected Results
When you access the portal to raise a request, the date and time field shows the current time based on the timezone set in your customer profile or in your Atlassian account

h3. Actual Results
However, date time picker shows the current time based on your browser's timezone
 !Example1.png|thumbnail! 
Note that once you enter a value here, it is converted to the user's timezone correctly. Refer to the example in the comments section.
 
h3.Workaround
Mention the time based on your timezone
fields.summary: custom date and time field do not display the sample time in the reporter's timezone on the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, customers can leave the portal form without submitting it without any timeout which would close the page.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to set a timeout for customers to submit their request.
fields.summary: Add a timeout in the portal due to inactivity

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the old issue view, adding a table to a request description will add an extra column to the table when seeing the request in the Customer Portal.

 !old_issue_view_table_in_jsd.png|thumbnail! 

 !table_in_customer_portal.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using the old issue view, add a table to the request description
 # Open the request in the customer portal

h3. Expected Results
The table is shown with the expected number of columns

h3. Actual Results
The table has an extra column shown.

h3. Workaround

Use the new issue view to create tables in the request description.

Adding the table as a comment to the request instead of in the request description.

Using the new issue view, you can also remove the empty column from the existing requests to have the tables shown correctly in the portal.
fields.summary: Creating a table in the request description adds an extra column to the table when seen in the Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Editing a Queue is not possible as an Agent even if the account is a site admin
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Be a site admin
 # Add the site admin account to a JSD project as an Agent
 # Try to edit a Queue

h3. Expected Results

You should see the menu that allows to edit/delete a queue.
h3. Actual Results

The menu is not visible.
h3. Workaround

Set the account as a project administrator in the People section.
fields.summary: Editing a Queue is not possible as an Agent even if the account is a site admin

fields.description:
So that an issue can be further locked down to where just the specified users can access it.

An example use case would be where in one project, containing multiple groups of employees, it would be possible to limit some groups access to particular tasks.
fields.summary: Ability to have issue level security in next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Testing

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Testing 1
 # Testing 2

h3. Expected Results

Testing

h3. Actual Results

Testing

h3. Workaround

Testing
fields.summary: Testing ignore

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When clicking on the *Customers* page of a project with many customers, the page takes a long time to load or even times out.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a project with many customers
 # Try to load the *Customers* page

h3. Expected Results
The page loads in a few seconds and doesn't result in a timed out response.

h3. Actual Results

The pages takes a while (e.g., 30 seconds) and sometimes even timing out.
h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Viewing the Customers page for a project which has many customers results in a long delay or timeout

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the subject of the emails sent from the domain *163.com* are not parsed correctly by Jira. Due to this, even when the email contains an issue key in the subject line, Jira mail cannot identify it and instead of adding the body of this email to the existing ticket, Jira ends up creating a new issue.

The subject of the emails sent from this domain is UTF-8 Q encoded.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Jira to identify the encoding and parse the subject correctly so that it can identify all the characters in the subject line and then process the email accordingly
fields.summary: Ability to correctly parse subject of the email sent from 163.com

fields.description: There are frequently UI elements or visual elements that I'd like to hide or alter to optimized the experience for my company. It would be extremely helpful if Atlassian offered a way for my admin team to add our own CSS to the header.
fields.summary: Custom CSS in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issue keys on comments made in the old issue view are rendered with a "#icft=KEY" breadcrumb breaking the link for customers

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a customer on two different tickets
# Post a comment with the issue key only from one of the tickets to the other (in the old issue view)
# logged as the customer, access the ticket and click the link generated on the portal

h3. Expected Results
The customer is properly directed to the other ticket

h3. Actual Results
# The link is created with a "#icft=KEY" breadcrumb
The customer is directed to the other ticket, but then quickly redirected to the portal home


h3. Workaround
Provide the customer with a full "https://instance.atlassian.net/browse/ISSUE-KEY" link.
fields.summary: Issue keys on comments made in the old issue view are rendered with a "#icft=KEY" breadcrumb breaking the link for customers

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, the value inserted in "Date Picker Field" during issue creation are following the instance "Default user time zone" configuration in General Configuration. However, when it's created , the value follow the profile time zone.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the "Default user time zone" configuration in General Configuration to (GMT-06:00) Chicago
# Set the profile time zone to Asia/Kuala Lumpur
# Then, create a "Date Time Picker" field and add to the request form.
# Create the issue and set the date to 25/Dec/2019 00:00

h3. Expected Results
When the issue created , the field value display as 25/Dec/2019 00:00

h3. Actual Results
The field value display as 25/Dec/2019 14:00

h3.Workaround
Change the profile timezone based on the "Default user time zone".
fields.summary: "Date Time Picker" field value in Customer Portal during creation not the same when the issue created

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 - When a software user is given a project role "Service desk team" (Collaborator). It is expected for these users should not be able to see the SLA timer in the service desk ticket.
 - In the old issue view, when this sort of situation arises, the SLA timer should not show up in the ticket :  !Screen Shot 2019-12-24 at 10.53.43 AM.png|thumbnail! 

 - In the new issue view, there is a box with shows as SLA with an exclamation mark.
 !Screen Shot 2019-12-24 at 10.55.22 AM.png|thumbnail! 

This could be confusing for users where they would have the impression that they should be able to see the SLA 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a jira software user into the people's page and provide service desk team role
 # Go to a ticket

h3. Expected Results
Should not see the SLA timer

h3. Actual Results

Able to see both the SLA box but with an exclamation mark

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: SLA box loads with exclamation mark for collaborators in new issue view

fields.description:
Using Jira Service Desk to manage support. However this does not save you from that.
Can we have the option to set a minimum description length?
fields.summary: option to set a minimum description length for tickets on JSD Jira Service Desk

fields.description:
I would like my customers to be able to browse (not search only) for my knowledge base articles from my service desk portal. 

I want to display a list of my knowledge base articles from my portal, so they are visibly displayed rather than my customers needing to perform a search to surface my knowledgebase content.
fields.summary: Browse Knowledge Base articles from Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, knowledge base category are not part of the language support configuration. Due to that , when customer using other language , the knowledge base category still displaying in the preset wording.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add knowledge base category in language support configuration.

h3. Why this is important
 When customer using other language, all other fields ( request type group , request type and etc) are following the language configured, but the knowledge base category still remains the same.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Add "Knowledge Base category" field in "Language Support" configuration

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

Currently, you can set forwarding emails to the Service Desk project, there is no ability to send or set up forwarding rules that can email external clients for business purposes from the Service Desk project. 

In theory, the forwarding rule should work like the following:

- A customer sends an email to the Service Desk project, an issue is created
- the mail handler checks the email content and tracks a preset list of external clients to forward the email. 
- The email is then forwarded an ensures the same mail header is utilized
- This is so that when the external client comments, the comment is appended to the existing original email created. 
 
*Suggested Solution*

Integrate the forwarding rule ability into the mail request page that allows the user to use the Service Desk project in a more flexible way.
fields.summary: Ability to Have Forwarding Rule that Sends Emails Post Issue Creation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's not possible to add parameters to the customer portal URL.

h3. Suggested Solution
When a customer open the portal , the user ID and user country will automatically populated in the customer portal URL. On top of that , it will also will auto populated in the customer portal form if the field are added to the form.

h3. Why this is important
 It's easier for the user as the field will automatically populated.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Provide functionality to add User ID and User Country paramater in Customer Portal URL

fields.description:
Currently, it's only possible to search asset in jql by their value.

It could increase attrictivity of asset field (especially for connect apps) if it would be possible to search asset by field values directly from JQL.
fields.summary: Asset fields exposed to JQL

fields.description:
Currently, a user must be in a group which has the *Administer Jira* global permission in order to reorder queues in a Jira Service Desk project.

This should be granted by having the *Administrators* role within the project instead as dragging and dropping queues into a certain order in the sidebar doesn't affect other projects.
fields.summary: Project administrators should be allowed to drag and drop queues

fields.description:
After configuring the new feature JSDCLOUD-1924 that allows adding trusted email domains to the allow list to ensure they aren't marked as spam, the email processing logs will first show any email from the whitelisted domain as *Rejected*, and then *successfully* processed in the very next attempt. Refer to the below screenshot:
 !email processing logs.png|thumbnail! 


*Suggestion:*
It is difficult to track if there is an email that was rejected and never processed.
This can sometimes confuse customers to identify genuine rejections, the emails that are genuinely Rejected due to valid reason Versus the rejections due to bulk/Jira/autoreply filters which are then successfully processed in the very next attempt if the domain is whitelisted. 
So an option to not display Rejected emails processing logs if the same email is then processed successfully in the very next attempt will be helpful
fields.summary: Option to not display Rejected emails processing logs if the same email is then processed successfully in the very next attempt because the domain is whitelisted

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
- When a software user is given a project role "Service desk team". It is expected for these users to be able to add an internal comment on service desk tickets as mentioned in the article : [How can service desk and development teams work together with Jira Service Desk and Jira Software? \- Jira Service Desk Cloud \- Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/how-can-service-desk-and-development-teams-work-together-with-jira-service/]
- In the old issue view, when this sort of situation arises, these Jira users (no service desk access) should only be able to see the "comment internally" button only :

- In the new issue view, there is still a button called "Reply to the customer" which when users click on that and add their comment, it still becomes an internal comment rather than external.
 !Reply to customer.png|thumbnail! 

This could be confusing for users where they would have the option to Reply to customer even though it's actually made as an internal comment


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a jira software user into the people's page and provide service desk team role
 # Go to a ticket and add a comment

h3. Expected Results
Should only see add internal note button

h3. Actual Results
Able to see both internal and reply to customer button


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Reply to customer button shows up for software users in new issue view

fields.description:
Having the ability to hide issue types and only show the available request types in the create issue screen of Jira Service Desk projects would prevent issues from being created without a request type.

 

!print.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to hide Issue types in the Create Issue screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Changing inline status in queues one after the other results in an error, where the focus remains on the previously updated inline status
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change inline status in a queue
 # Change another inline status in the same queue

h3. Expected Results

See the focus ring move to the newly selected status, and move away from the previously selected one.
h3. Actual Results

- The gif attached demonstrates the erroneous behaviour
 # all of the things are retaining a focus ring - they should only have a focus ring when they’re _actually_ focused
 # when a previous thing completes it breaks the new things popup - as seen when i click the second thing and it displays “we couldnt..” etc

h3. Workaround

Can update statuses inline but focus ring remains active on wrong inline status
fields.summary: Changing inline status in queues one after the other results in an error

fields.description:
With the implementation of JSDCLOUD-1211, Request Types on the new "Type" field displayed on the Create Issue screen are not being properly sorted.

It'd be best to have a specific sorting for them using some pre-defined list such as alphabetically, creation time, most used ones.
fields.summary: Sort Request Types on the Create Issue Screen

fields.description:
Currently, tables copied from NETCHB are being pasted as tables on Jira, with the wrong formatting.

It'd be optimal to paste them as images instead.
fields.summary: Paste tables copied from NETCHB as images

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If an email is sent to a JSD project email address to create a new ticket and this email contains one or more large attachments (8-20MB), there seems to be an edge case where JEPP will process the same email multiple times as it will be picked up again before the processing of the attachments is complete. 
This will create multiple issues from the same email.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSD project.
 # Enable the email channel for incoming JSD tickets.
 # Send an email with large attachments (between 8-20MB) to the project's email address to create a new ticket. 

h3. Expected Results
The email and attachments are processed once and a single ticket is created.

h3. Actual Results
The same email may be processed multiple times creating duplicate JSD tickets 

*This can be confirmed by cloud support by checking the email headers in {{A0_2C4E5C_MAIL_ITEM_CHUNK}} table and if the email ID for in each header for each ticket matches this confirms the same email has been processed multiple times. 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available, however, you can just delete the duplicate tickets if they are created.
fields.summary: When processing an email with large attachments for incoming emails to a JSD project JEPP may process the same email more than once causing duplicate issues

fields.description: When users access our customer portal we have suggested articles for each request types. At the end of the article is a link, "Need to raise a request? ?Contact us". The link takes the user back to the beginning of the customer portal. The user then has to click through the portal to get back to the request type they were at. Instead of going back to the beginning of the portal, we would like the user to go back to the request type. Since the article didn't resolve their issue, we want them to submit a request. And we feel taking the user back to the beginning of the process would cause frustration and might stop them from submitting a request.
fields.summary: Ability to Modify Link, "Need to raise a request? Contact us"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4475].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Currently, the 'Organization' field in Service Desk can be set as a required field and added to the 'Create' screen for an issue. The problem with this is that the 'Organization' selection only shows up in the Customer Portal and will not appear as a visible field in the Create screen, thus making it impossible for an admin to require an organization to be chosen, and create a Service Desk ticket through JIRA rather than the Portal. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Set 'Organization' as a required field

2. Add the field to the create screen in a Service Desk project
h3. Expected Results

The field should be visible and able to be set, or Service Desk should not allow you to set the field as required. 
h3. Actual Results

The field will only be visible in the Customer Portal and a user will not be able to create a ticket in that project through JIRA.
h3. Notes 

This might be intended functionality (as Organization is primarily a contact field and is meant as an option for customers to share a ticket with their org.), but allowing it to be set as required and put into a 'Create' screen causes confusion, as the ability implies that this field can be set through JIRA during issue creation.
fields.summary: Organization Field can be set to Required in Create Screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the Portal, accessing the Requests list will display the list of requests including the "Reference"/issue key. If the issue key is too long, it will not be fully displayed in the column correctly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Project Settings > Change the project key to one with 8 characters and above
 # On Firefox browser, Go to the portal and select "Requests" 
 

h3. Expected Results

Issue key should fully displayed into next line:  !image-2019-12-17-16-28-29-512.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Issue key is cut off  !image-2019-12-17-16-28-49-117.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Try to change the zoom setting of the browser or use other browsers such as Chrome, Edge, IE11, etc.
fields.summary: Issue key is cut off if too long in Portal view using Firefox

fields.description:
When a user who is already licensed (e.g., Confluence and Jira Software, but not Jira Service Desk) on an instance is added to a project as a customer, they do not receive a notification as such.

It would be nice if there was an option to send that user a notification telling them that they can use their Atlassian Account credentials to access that project as a customer.
fields.summary: Send notification to user that they have been added to a JSD project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently when users go back to third party plugin queue from JIRA Issue , the page will not load.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. View "Vendor queues" page under project A so that it's remembered as the last viewed page.
2. Go to Issue Navigator and view a request coming from project A.
3. Click on the project link (displayed next to issue key in the new issue view).

h3. Expected Results
It will redirected to the queue and successfully load it.

h3. Actual Results
We're being redirected to project A but the page doesn't load

h3. Workaround

The workaround is to navigate to the add-on queue via the sidebar navigation, or removing the /jira/servicedesk prefix
fields.summary: Vendor queues not loading on direct page load

fields.description: [christophe.parsade.e@thalesdigital.io|mailto:christophe.parsade.e@thalesdigital.io]
fields.summary: no acces to Jira : login acount unavailable

fields.description:
Currently, the only way to change the issue type of a service desk ticket is to move it to another issue type in the same project. Which renders the request type to NO MATCH.

It would be handy to be able to choose any request type and the corresponding issue type should automatically be changed. If the new request type is using a different workflow, then move dialogue should be initiated automatically with some explanation for the user.
fields.summary: Changing request type should select appropriate issue type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Editing the first letter of the 'Administrators', 'Service Desk Team', or 'Service Desk Customers' project role name to lowercase causes project creation to fail and displays message *Project not created For some reason the magic didn't happen. Click Create to try again.*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Jira settings* > *System* > *Project roles*;
 # Edit the name of 'Administrators', 'Service Desk Team', or 'Service Desk Customers' changing the first letter to lowercase;
 # Try to create a new JSD project.

h3. Expected Results

The project is successfully created.
h3. Actual Results

The creation fails showing the error below.

!print.png|width=293,height=92!
h3. Workaround

Rename the role back to the first letter in uppercase.
fields.summary: Lowercase project role names make project creation fail

fields.description:
It would be nice to have the option to configure Security level for Next-Gen projects as on Classic ones.

---

Please provide us with more information as to why this feature would be important to your organization and how you plan to use it to inform our R&D efforts, thanks!
fields.summary: Add the ability to configure Issue security level

fields.description:
h3. Summary

CSV import (Issue navigator and External System Import) does not add request participants when using email addresses. The ticket is created but no request participants are added.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Go to the issue navigator or external system import features;
# Try to import the tickets using the request participant email address.
||summary||request participant||
|Test issue|testuser@test.com|


h3. Expected results

Tickets are imported using the email address and parsing to their accounts.

h3. Actual result

Jira creates the ticket, no errors are shown and the ticket does not have request participants.

h3. Workaround

Create a ticket with support at [here|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/] asking for the CSV with email address and accountIDs
fields.summary: Import CSV does not add request participants on issues when using email addresses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When filtering tickets, if we add resolution = Unresolved or resolution is EMPTY it won’t show unresolved tickets from next-gen SD projects.

!Screenshot 2019-12-13_11-41-27-516.png|width=945,height=218!
h3. !Screenshot 2019-12-13_12-06-00-728.png|width=938,height=284!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create tickets on next-gen project templates.
 # Go to Issues and Filters > Search issues.
 # If the ticket is assigned to you, use My Open Issues.
 ## If you are not the assignee, first check the “All issues” and then filter unresolved tickets.

h3. Expected Results

It will show all the unresolved tickets assigned to you or all unresolved ones.
h3. Actual Results

It shows unresolved tickets from all projects, except next-gen Service Desk.

!Screen Recording 2019-12-13 at 12.08 PM.gif|width=871,height=256!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Filtering by Unresolved won’t show tickets created on next-gen projects

fields.description: We want our service desk customers to see more data on their request page as the date of creation tickets or other relevant data for ease of use and convenience. Also, our customers need better filtering options on the said page as a customer has more than 10 - 20 tickets things can get quite hectic. At the moment we can not modify the page. More customization options would be appreciated
fields.summary: As a user I want my Service Desk Customers to Add Fields to Their Request Page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When displaying a field for select-list (multi/single choice) in the new portal design, it doesn't show the same order from the field configuration which configured for the edit options.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a multi/single choice select list custom field on Jira
# Add that custom field to the create screen
# Go to the project settings > request types and add the field
# From the portal, check the custom field options order

h3. Expected Results
* The select list shows the same order from the field configuration in the portal

h3. Actual Results
* Seeing the inconsistency of the order from the portal view and the field configuration

h3. Workaround

* None.
fields.summary: Multi/single choice select list custom field does not show the correct order of options in the portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Accessing the ticket from the queue, while in the old issue view, and trying to apply a date using the calendar option nothing happens because the calendar doesn't display.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Projects*
 # Select the project
 # *Queues*
 # Select a ticket and try to add a date value using the calendar option

h3. Expected Results

The calendar is displayed and you can select the desired date
h3. Actual Results

You click on the calendar icon and nothing happens, see the gif:

!Screen Recording 2019-12-12 at 04.46 PM.gif|thumbnail!

The following error is returning at the console:

!Screen Shot 2019-12-12 at 17.03.37.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 # Manually add the value.
 # Use the New JSD issue view.
 # Access the ticket from a quick search option. The URL of the ticket must be something like https://<instance>.atlassian.net/browse/<Pkey>-<Issue number>, see gif:

!Screen Recording 2019-12-12 at 04.52 PM.gif|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Calendar for Date picker fields doesn't work for old issue view when accessing the ticket from the Queue

fields.description:
h3. Problem

From the doc https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/edit-the-content-of-your-customer-notifications/ it is possible to add the variable ${request.details} to customer notifications, but it is not available in the variables drop-down, neither writing it.

h3. Suggested resolution

Have the ability to use the ${request.details} variable in customer notifications.
fields.summary: The ${request.details} variable is not available in the Cloud customer notifications

fields.description: At the moment, the search bar in the Jira Service Desk customer portal searching through request types as well as the knowledge base. If you have only very few request types and are not using the Confluence knowledge base, this search bar is useless. It would be great if this search bar also returns existing and closed tickets.
fields.summary: Allow searching tickets in customer portal search bar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It is not possible to add a customer to an existing organization which is added to multiple projects
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an organization to multiple projects.
 # Change your language to French. Add a customer to the organization

h3. Expected Results
A warning "The organization is used in X other projects. Customers you add to it can view requests shared with the organization and raise their own requests in those projects". Customer is added to the organization
h3. Actual Results
The warning is not displayed and customer is not added to the organization.

h3. Workaround
Change your profile language to other languages such as English.
fields.summary: Adding customers to an organization in French language is not possible

fields.description: The old agent view used to have the feature that allows agents to search and share the linked knowledge base articles from the issue screen. This feature seems to be removed in the new issue view. It would be great if it comes back.
fields.summary: Ability to search for knowledge bases from the agent view in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a Request type is removed from an issue that previously had a Request Type mapped to it, the issue will still be visible on the Customer Portal

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue on Service desk Project with a Request Type mapped.
 # Remove the Request type from the issue.
# The issue will still be visible on the portal


h3. Expected Results

Issue should not be visible on the portal once the Request type is removed.

h3. Actual Results

Request will still be visible on the portal.

h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state.
fields.summary: Issues with an invalid request type are visible on the Portal

fields.description:
Reports are missing logged time series.

We are billing clients for a logged time spent on tickets beyond amount from agreement.

To do so we need to have information on how each organization used the agency time in a given period. The problem is that reports series are missing logged time and there is no way to group the time by Organization.
fields.summary: Missing logged time in report series

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
When attempting to add an inactive user as a customer to a project, the error message will show *The following customers could not be added...Please check email and try again*

h3. Proposed Solution
Improve the error message by mentioning that the user with the email already exists but is rather inactive
fields.summary: Improve the error message of adding inactive users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For Internet Explorer 11 (IE11), the configuration page of Customer notifications is too long in a horizontal way.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Customer notifications config page https://EXAMPLE.atlassian.net/servicedesk/admin/EXAMPLE/customer-notifications
**  !Screenshot 2019-12-11 18.02.16.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The page is available for IE11 users.

h3. Actual Results

The page is too wide and you cannot browse the page at a glance.
There's no console error in the browser. So most likely, some CSS work unexpectedly with IE11.

h3. Workaround

Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.

Until then, please use Chrome if applicable.
fields.summary: Customer notifications config page is too wide for IE11 users

fields.description:
Currently, when a customer satisfaction survey is answered and a comment is added, it takes back the user to a screen as below:

 !Screenshot 2019-11-20 at 3.11.22 PM.png|thumbnail! 

It would be handy if the service desk administrator can hide *Help center* link for selected projects from customer satisfaction settings.
fields.summary: Ability to hide help center link from post-satisfaction survey screen

fields.description: Though the comment field in the support portal provides table features, it would be great if users could copy&paste the tables from Excel
fields.summary: Support copy&pasting Excel tables in the customer portal comment field

fields.description:
Currently, when approval is set up and a pre-filled hidden approver custom field is used, as the issue reaches the approval status, both the approver field and approver user name is shown on the customer portal. In some cases, customers may not be required to know the approver's name. _See [Set up a pre\-set list of approvers|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/set-up-a-pre-set-list-of-approvers/]_.

The suggestion is to provide the ability to actually hide the approver field and approver's name from the customer portal.
fields.summary: Ability to hide approver field and name in the customer portal

fields.description: Please add a "printer friendly" version of the Request via a Print button on the screen.
fields.summary: Ability to Print from the Request Screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We all know that Boards are not available for Jira Service Desk, but we have the option to create a private board and add SD tickets there.

When adding a comment thought the board, the same as on Service Desk view, there is an option to add public and internal comments, which works as expected.

We also know that the Flag option is not available for Service Desk as mentioned [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-8481], but when we use this option thought a personal board, the Flag shows as a public comment, even if we select it as “Comment internally”.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a personal board where it shows Service Desk tickets.
 # Click on … to add a Flag
 # Select to add an internal comment

h3. Expected Results

The comment is internal and not shown on the portal.
h3. Actual Results

The comment for Flags shows in the customer portal and also a notification is sent to the customer.

!Screen Recording 2019-12-10 at 10.47 AM.gif|width=531,height=299!

!Screenshot 2019-12-10_10-53-31-829.png|width=373,height=208!

 
h3. Workaround

Add the flag and then add a new internal comment with the reasons.
fields.summary: Adding a Flag on a Service Desk ticket using a Board, shows the comment and flag as public, even selecting “Comment internally”

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

There is currently no way to group customers into organization (to categorized them) but at the same time don't want all members of the organization to access each others tickets when the ticket is shared with the organization for specific users to access the tickets. Need to only mark specific users as the members of the organization who should be the ones to have access to all tickets created by other members of the organization.

h3. Proposed Solution

Need the option to set users within a service desk organization as the users who will by default have access to all tickets created by org. members and receive notification for all issue created by org.. members , and the unmarked organizations members should not have access or receive notification unless marked to be "special" members.
fields.summary: Provide option to set customers as organization "special members" within a service desk organization

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Previously queues could be Ctrl + clicked on to be opened in a new tab. Recently this functionality has been broken
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a list of queues in the sidebar e.g. <instance>.com/jira/servicedesk/projects/ABC/queues/custom/1
 # Hold down CTRL key (or Cmd key if you are on a Mac) and click on a queue in the grey sidebar.

h3. Expected Results

The queue should open in a new tab.
h3. Actual Results

The queue opens in the same window.
h3. Workaround

Right click on a queue, and choose the "open in a new tab" option.
fields.summary: Ctrl + clicking on a queue in the sidebar should open it in a new tab

fields.description:
Currently, it's not possible to sort the queues on the request type field if it is included in the queue columns. Hovering the mouse over the request type field doesn't show ascending or descending arrow.

The suggestion is to provide the ability to be able to sort on the request type field.
fields.summary: Ability to sort queues on request type field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Admins need to have the ability to turn on notifications for Org members
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Currently when an organisation is added, an email is sent to the Org members so they can choose to follow on the request and receive notifications. this by default is turned off and customers can turn it on by going to the portal.
h3. Expected Results

Admins need to have the control whether these notifications will by default be ON or OFF
h3. Actual Results

N/A
h3. Workaround

Org members to go to the portal and turn on the notifications for the requests they want to follow
fields.summary: Provide Ability to turn on notifications for Organisation members to the Admins

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When creating a request in the customer portal, the attachments added during the creation of the request are shown as a comment in the ticket activity, and not in the request summary on the request details page.

!attachment_request_detail_view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Move the initial attachments added to the request to the request summary.

h3. Workaround
No workaround is currently possible.
fields.summary: Move attachments to the request summary on the request details page of the customer portal

fields.description:
N.B. This bug applies to both the old issue view and the new issue view.

h3. Issue Summary

Requests raised on behalf of a customer using global create in Jira displays initial attachments in a separate *Attachments* panel, whereas requests raised by customers via email or from the customer portal display initial attachments as a comment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From within Jira, click the *Create* button.
 # Select a Jira Service Desk project.
 # Select a request type
# Choose a customer in the 'raise on behalf of' field
 # Add an attachment during issue creation.

h3. Expected Results

The attachments added during the creation of the request should be displayed as a comment, as it does with requests created via email or from the customer portal.

!issue_created_from_portal.png|width=868,height=508!

h3. Actual Results

The attachments show up under an *Attachments* panel

!issue_created_in_Jira.png|width=868,height=584!

h3. Workaround
Add attachments to request after it has been created so that it displays in comments (and to customers, if desired) OR raise request via portal.
fields.summary: Creating a request with attachments from within Jira shows attachment panel

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access any custom report of a JSD project;
 # In the 'Show' option, select Custom dates;
 # Click to show data of any series;
 !print.png|thumbnail!
 # Click on *Return to summary table*
 !print2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

You go back to the summary table
h3. Actual Results

You see the error below
 !print3.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Use the browser's "Back" button.
fields.summary: Clicking on "Return to summary table" in JSD reports throws error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If customers to reply to an e-mail without the issue key, a new issue is added instead of a comment.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to enable comments to be added based on issue summary/ email subject.
fields.summary: Add comment if summary already exists

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently, the same as the request type that we edit for the customer portal, we need to edit it one by one.
h3. Suggestion

It would be great if administrators could edit the layout of the context fields all at once since some sites have many request types and it's not a good option to go one by one to let all using the same pattern.
fields.summary: Ability to configure issue layout for all request types instead of one by one

fields.description:
hello, we made serevral tests, tickets are not coming in our queue.

can you check?
fields.summary: no inccoming tickets!!! urgent!!!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, the order of request types is only applicable to the JIRA Service Desk customer portal. The request types that are displayed in JIRA on the Type's field is ordered based on the request type id
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Re-order the request types
 # Click on + to create a JIRA issue on a service desk project
 # Check the order of the request type through the type field.

h3. Expected Results

The order of the request type on the type field is following the request type's order in the Request type settings
h3. Actual Results

Type field is not respecting the order of the request types
 - Request type Settings:
 !image-2019-12-06-14-33-20-935.png|width=754,height=374!
 - Type field:
 !image-2019-12-06-14-33-50-622.png|width=463,height=512!

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Type field is not respecting the order of the request types

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* When looking at queues, issues with Summary field values that contain strings longer than 26 characters will not wrap
* Would be a problem for use cases where monitoring tools are configured to send alert emails to Jira Service Desk and service/server hostnames need to be displayed in the queue
* The Summary field "bleeds" into other columns
* In the below example, the Description field displays within the column as expected, but the Summary field does not:
 !Screenshot 2019-12-05 at 16.10.51.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue where the Summary field contains a continuous string of characters longer than 26 characters
 # View the issue in a queue

h3. Expected Results
The Summary field text wraps neatly within the  Summary column.

h3. Actual Results
The text does not wrap and "bleeds" into the proceeding column(s) - see the screenshot in the "Issue Summary".

h3. Workaround
*  Avoid the use of words/strings that are longer than 26 characters
*  Use spaces in between words
*  Increase the width of the browser window/tab
 !Screenshot 2019-12-05 at 16.11.03.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Queues: Summary field label/field does not wrap when the page is resized

fields.description:
While using user provisioning we can configure some [user's attributes|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/#limitations] and would be nice to be able to show those attributes within Jira tickets and be able to use them in other parts of the system such as JQL filters.

*Workaround:*
* There is a third-party add-on that provides this for Azure integration:
** [Azure AD Attributes for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220477/azure-ad-attributes-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]
fields.summary: Provide the ability to display user's attributes

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the issue has a big number of attachments (e.g. ~90+), the attachments will appear broken in the portal and in the new issue view, the customers won't be able to download or view them.

h3. Environment

JSD tickets with ~90 attachments or more.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Create a ticket and add more than 90 attachments;
# View the ticket from the portal or from the new issue view;
# Try to download/view an attachment.

h3. Expected results

Jira will show all the attachments in the portal and in the new issue view.

h3. Actual result

The attachments appear broken in the portal and in the new issue view, it is also not downloadable.
 !Screen Shot 2019-12-05 at 11.46.29.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

* Reduce the number of attachments;
* Split it in different tickets;
* [Turn the new issue view off|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/changes-to-issues-in-the-new-issue-view/].
* View the tickets in the old view by adding *?oldIssueView=true* to the end of the URL. E.g. https://instance.atlassian.net/browse/TST-1234?oldIssueView=true
fields.summary: Broken attachments due to a large number of files in the issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to delete transition rule in JSD next-gen projects.
 This can be reproduced in Google Chrome, Apple Safari, and Mozilla Firefox browsers.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a transition rule to a workflow transition in a next-gen project
 # Click *Edit rule* in the workflow editor
 # Click *Delete rule*

h3. Expected Results

The transition rule is deleted.
h3. Actual Results

Edit transition windows closes but the rule still exists.
h3. Workaround

Delete and recreate the transition.
fields.summary: Deleting transition rule in next-gen project is not possible

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*

For sites with large number of articles, sorting by last update time (which is the default sort right now) is not very useful. And makes it hard to guess where in the list an article will appear.

*Suggested solution:*
 * Either the default sorting order should be by the *title*
 * Or allow the user to change sorting order by clicking on the column headers
fields.summary: Ability to sort knowledge base articles by title, category and views

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a next-gen or a classic project on a standard plan, the customer permissions are set to "Customers my team adds to the project" (open or private), but on a Free plan, even selecting the project as private, it will set the permission to "Anyone with an account".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a Cloud Free site, create a Service Desk project.

h3. Expected Results

Only who created the project will have permission and the customer permissions are set to "Customers my team adds to the project".
h3. Actual Results

After the project is created, if we go to the customer's page, all users and customers will be listed and they can access the project through the portal normally.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When creating a new project, customer permissions are set to "Anyone"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding a *Request participant* (or *Request participants*) in new issue view doesn't actually add them to the ticket.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View a ticket in new issue view
 # Add a *Request participant*
 # Refresh the page
 # Observe that the *Request participant* field has not changed and the history shows it never occurred

h3. Expected Results

The *Request participant* is added.
h3. Actual Results

The page shows them as added until refreshing and seeing they were never added to begin with.
- https://share.getcloudapp.com/GGuAX2m0

h3. Workaround

Adding the *Request participant* in the old issue view works (clicking the link at the top of the ticket to go there or appending *?oldIssueView=true* to the end of the URL). But if you get back to the new issue view and add any other participant, it will erase everyone in the field.
fields.summary: Adding a Request Participant in new issue view doesn't actually add them to the ticket

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using a custom field of type date picker, the calendar is not opening when clicking the calendar icon in the old issue view in Jira Service Desk. The issue is only in the Google Chrome browser.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field of type date picker
 # Add the field to an issue type in a Jira Service Desk project
 # Open a ticket in the old issue view in the Service Desk project using Google Chrome, and click the calendar icon next to the custom field.

h3. Expected Results

The calendar should open and you should be able to choose a date.
h3. Actual Results

The calendar does not open. Dates have to be entered manually

The below error is thrown in the Chrome Console:
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property '0' of undefined
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

1. Use the new issue view.

2. Add the date manually to the field.

3. Click the issue key at the top of the page to open the issue in the general Jira issue browser view, instead of Service Desk, and the date picker is working.

4. Use the Mozilla Firefox or Apple Safari browsers.
fields.summary: Date picker not showing on a custom field of type Date Picker in the old issue view in Jira Service Desk when using Google Chrome.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to click on *Copy to other request types* unless a change has been made to a next-gen workflow.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an issue type in a next-gen JSD project
 # Click on *...* and see that *Copy to other request types* is grayed out

h3. Expected Results
The option is not grayed out.

h3. Actual Results
The option is grayed out.

h3. Workaround

Make a change to the workflow and the option is no longer grayed out.
fields.summary: Unable to click on Copy to other request types unless a change has been made to a next-gen workflow

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Renamed users cannot be searched using their email in the Request Type hidden preset field

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change a user's username
# Search for the user using their email in the hidden preset field in Request Type configuration

h3. Expected Results
The user is retrieved
h3. Actual Results
The user is not retrieved

h3. Workaround
Search using the display name instead
fields.summary: Renamed users cannot be selected as preset user when using their email in Request Type configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Renamed users cannot be searched using their email in the Assignee field

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change a user's username
# Search for the user using their email in the Assignee field

h3. Expected Results
The user is retrieved
h3. Actual Results
The user is not retrieved

h3. Workaround
Search using the display name instead or use the new issue view
fields.summary: Renamed users in the old issue view cannot be searched using email for Assignee

fields.description:
When integrating Service Desk and Confluence in order to work with [knowledge bases|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confeval/jira-service-desk-evaluator-resources/jira-service-desk-knowledge-base-with-confluence], there is an option to add categories to include articles within them. Each category can have its own descriptions, but, those only allow pure text to be used.

This is a suggestion to allow hyperlinks to be used in the category's description so the user can click on it in order to be redirected to helpful information about the portal or the knowledge base itself.
fields.summary: Ability to add hyperlinks to the category's description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, when a request form has a field with custom field type "Select List (single choice)" and the value contains 3.5K value, the field will be loaded slow. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a "Select List (single choice)" custom field.
 # Add around 3.5K value
# Then, add the field to request type form.
# Go to Customer Portal and load the field. 
# Try to key in any value to search it

h3. Expected Results
The field will loaded fine and when key in the wording will be smooth.

h3. Actual Results
The field loaded slightly slow and when key in the wording it has a sticky effect. The word display a bit slow.

h3. Workaround
Reduce the number of field values.
fields.summary: Field in Customer Portal loaded slow when it contains a lot of values

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When non-agents accesses a project, they would land on https://<domain>/jira/servicedesk/projects/<projectID>/issues instead of https://<domain>/projects/<projectID>/issues/?filter=allopenissues hence the issues would not be displayed despite the users having Browse Project permission
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a Jira Software licensed user who is not an agent into the Service Desk Team role
 # As the user, access Project > <ProjectName>

h3. Expected Results
Lands on a valid URL https://<domain>/projects/<projectID>/issues/?filter=allopenissues
h3. Actual Results
Lands on an invalid URL https://<domain>/jira/servicedesk/projects/<projectID>/issues

h3. Workaround
Upon landing, click on the filters again to load the page again
fields.summary: Non-agents accessing project lands them on an invalid URL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inserting an issue key into a description field with the service desk automation rule will create an invisible character in the issue key so that it will break a hyperlink.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule to create an issue on some action(example: comment added).
 # Configure the description to create issue link using the variable ${sourceissue.key}Description looks like this:

          *Service Desk Ticket ID:*
          [https://test.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/$|https://test.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/$/]{sourceissue.key}
 # Add comment to the issue Test-1

h3. Expected Results

 Should create an issue with description and link should navigate to issue

           *Service Desk Ticket ID:*
           [https://test.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/Test-1] 
h3. Actual Results

Creates an issue with description and link is broken

           *Service Desk Ticket ID:*
           [https://test.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/Test]<200c>-1

 
h3. Workaround

Copy the url and remove the '<200c>'
fields.summary: Adding issue link into a description field with the service desk automation rule breaks a hyperlink

fields.description: Currently, in the next-gen projects, there is no option to configure the agent's notifications like their classic counterparts. It would be very handy if this feature can be built for next-gen projects.
fields.summary: Agent notification settings in next-gen project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
On a classic Service Desk project, users would now be able to select either a Request Type of Issue Type upon creating an issue.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to choose to choose either Request Type only, Issue Type only or both
h3. Why this is important
Users would need to do more scrolling down to the end of the list to find Issue Type they need as the Request Types are also displaying now
fields.summary: Provide the ability to only choose Issue Types for issue created from Create Issue Screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In [How global customer permissions impact project customer permissions|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/how-global-permissions-affect-project-permissions/], the Global permission *Can customers create their own accounts?* option for *No, only my team can create accounts* - _Customers must be added to a service desk before they can create an account and raise a request. This is generally for service desks that specific customers or teams use_ implies that admin/agents would need to manually add customers to use service desk functionality rather than the implicit behaviour of only allowing site users.
fields.summary: Improve documentation for Customer Permissions

fields.description:
h3. User story
As a Zapier user, I want to create a Jira Service Desk customer.

h3. Possible solution(s)
Add an action to the Jira Service Desk Zapier app to create a new customer.
It should specify the Service Desk project to add the customer to.
fields.summary: As a Zapier user, I want to create Zaps that create a Jira Service Desk customer

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the Jira Service Desk Zapier app to automation request creation, requests intermittently fail with a 403 response code. They usually work when re-run.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an account with Zapier
# Set up a Zap that uses the Create Request action
# Execute the Zap

Note: This issue cannot be reliably reproduced, but error logging points to an issue with the way we determine the scopes allowed for an endpoint in Jira. 

h3. Expected Results

The Zap is executed and a request is successfully created.

h3. Actual Results

The request fails with a 403 response code and the error message "OAuth2.0 is not enabled for this method"

h3. Workaround

Retry the failed Zap manually.
fields.summary: Creating a request using the Jira Service Desk Zapier app fails intermittently with 403s
